title: If you an Ap user prepare to adjust to your new build

replies.body:
{{item:3048}} {{item:3048}} {{item:3048}} {{item:3048}} {{item:3048}} {{item:3693}} 

The mana from the tears doesn't stack.
Ive seen a ryze build this with one ROA in ARAM LOL its was silly how big the shield was. I think he had 9k mana

{{item:3048}} {{item:3110}} {{item:3029}} {{item:3025}} {{item:3020}} {{item:3100}} 

Prepare your anus.
Lich Bane and Iceborn do not stack. So Luden's or a Magic pen item instead of Iceborn.

The passives don't stack damage, I was memeing about the mana gains.

I don't actually build Ryze like this.
They don't stack on top of each other, but they do stack in a sense.  You get the bonus damage from whichever one give the most damage and you also get the slow zone from iceborn.
I thought it does since you stack them one at a time.
Critbuild with no IE,,,,,,,,not approved.

Nobody would build that, 
1 its too expensive, 
2 it has no ie, 
3 you need protection
IE is about to get a massive rework.

> [{quoted}](name=The Yetii Rider,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=XAUZRzlw,comment-id=000200010000,timestamp=2018-04-18T19:01:02.589+0000)
>
> IE is about to get a massive rework.

Really ? It's about fucking time ! I remember way back in the day, when Riot deleted the dodge stat, everybody thought the crit stat would follow suit.

H O W  W R O N G  W E  W E R E
protection from what? The top lane bruiser who cant do anything in this bot lane meta :)
As a Jayce, if I saw you building no armor/health, one Accelerated shock blast would do 65% of your health mid/late game.
And then, I would AA something with Fleet Footwork and BT and be back to full LUL

> [{quoted}](name=PaladinNO,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=XAUZRzlw,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2018-04-18T15:42:53.628+0000)
>
> "For only 2,95 K damage a second, I will leave you...breathless." ~ {{champion:40}} 
> 
> https://pre00.deviantart.net/e091/th/pre/i/2013/039/e/7/lol___ad_janna_digi_art_throwdown_submission_by_temenuria-d5u8ivb.jpg

how does a janna do 295,000 damage a second? holy shit that would murder baron several times over with that dps.
It's her little iconic joke. Press /j in chat and she will say it

>how does a janna do 295,000 damage a second?

2,95 K. Not 295 K. EU numbers. It's a decimal. 
It wouldn't have the same ring to it if I wrote "2K95", or made it as obvious and boring as "2950".

I wanted to make a play on her joke. 

>Yes, it's true. For only $2.95 a minute, I will leave you breathless.
http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Janna/Quotes

...but still keep it believable. 

I have had a Wukong deal ~1900 damage to me in about 1,3 seconds, so with enough Dark Harvest stacks...

Yes, I did consider it could be misinterpreted. I just didn't think someone would actually comment on that possible misinterpretation, but instead read it for what it had to be. Because logic.

https://thumbs.gfycat.com/MeanTanBeardedcollie-size_restricted.gif ( ~ lategame {{champion:45}} )

I'm ahead of the curve

[https://imgur.com/ILLRzQG](https://imgur.com/ILLRzQG)
ADC {{champion:43}}  time. My absolute favorite champion since I started playing this game is now going to be useless.
Why are ap users so envious of adcs?... don't get it.

Because:
ADC items barely get touched. 
ADC items are op as fuck, with tons of damage, you can easily get over 2k damage with a single auto attack. 
ADCs don't need mana to deal any kind of damage, just right click any solo mage and poof, they're gone.

You can get 2k damage on auto...
If you are a full build Caitlyn headshot critting a caster minion.

The only adcs who have pulled off that shit were vayne pre Q+R nerf with a cheesy lethality crit build on other squishes.

Go do a standard game on someone like xayah, jinx, sivir, ashe, vayne and show me that 2k crit on a champion. 


Crits do a lot, but exaggeration does nothing to help the case of getting things fixed properly.

Literally from my match history, Cait with 100% crit chance and not even a full inventory, she dealt 2.4k damage per auto attack, I was 8 kills more fed than her and she dealt more damage overall than me by 20k, enjoy:

https://i.imgur.com/qggvBIf.png?2
https://i.imgur.com/kYCDkIi.png?1

{{champion:202}}  can actually do it with {{item:3124}}  stacks.

With that being said are people exaggerating a bit on the exact number, possibly however, ADCs AAs doing more than AP abilities that cost mana is not an exaggeration, that is just a fact.

There was a reason people were taking Ninja Tabis bot when the item itself didn't see any changes before people started taking it bot lane. The reason is pretty freaking obvious that AD is doing too much damage.
Supposedly we can look forward to some marksman itemization changes around 8.10 or 8.11
Because they get all the love and mages get all the nerfs. They literally said spellvamp is too OP for AP then made an AD spellvamp item.
Mages also have a spell vamp item{{item:3146}}  heals ALL damage
You insult mages everywhere by telling us that gunblade is a mage item lmfao. If anything it's an AP assassin item, but not a single mage is gonna waste the gold on that item.
lets not forget {{item:3072}} was always good on almost every ad champion while the one ap spell vamp item was niche and also kinda a support item to give Ap to other mages

> [{quoted}](name=The Bearded Bard,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=XAUZRzlw,comment-id=000a0001,timestamp=2018-04-18T17:55:48.161+0000)
>
> Because they get all the love and mages get all the nerfs. They literally said spellvamp is too OP for AP then made an AD spellvamp item.

Let's not forget that lifesteal is strong as fuck, but apparently that's not a problem, you know.

I'll just copy-paste my previous comment: 

Do you remember when ADCs/Top lane had to use their mana consuming abilities to deal damage? No? Because they never needed mana or mana management to kill someone, they don't need any kind of mana to deal damage, they just right click, auto attack and kill anyone squishy like mages/supports with 2 auto attacks.  

ADCs can dish out over 2k damage with a single right click, meanwhile mages need to do a whole rotation, sometimes 2 rotations to deal half the amount of damage a single ADC deals with ONE FUCKING AUTO ATTACK. 

Who needs to be balanced more, really? Simple logic, not that Riot's balance team knows what balance or logic is, even if it hit them square in the fucking face.
Well there was a time waaaaaaaaayyyyy back when toplane ad casters {{champion:126}} {{champion:80}} {{champion:121}} did need mana to be functional. Of course those days have long gone

a long time ago probs season 1 2 and maybe 3 ad casters needed mana hence {{item:3004}}  {{item:3508}} funny enough a long time ago {{item:3508}} used to have life steal but then they made it into a crit item for the life of me i dont know why they changed it i guess its because no one really bought the item since around that time AD champions started to not need mana as much

They changed it around the same time they released Muramana changing manamune from an AD/mana item for top lane fighters like Yorick, Jayce, Urgot, Blitz (yes, he was designed as an AD-fighter for toplane and was played as such/off tank for the first few years of League) into an item for ADCs, so they did the same thing to ER and a few other things.

Basically, like with most things, its ADCs and blatant favoritism by RIOT that caused those otherwise completely ass-backwards and completely illogical choices that also went about harming the game's health and balance.  Yay. ._.

i loved old essence weaver the change was ok i guess _**FOR THE ADC's**_ but every ad caster that might have liked in back then and in the future just lost a good item LUL its why i both love and hate the ADC role (the champions themselves bring a decent contribution to the league lore)
Either that or play lb, ahri and fizz. Ap assassins are still good. You just kill your laner, clear the wave (normally at the same time) and then back for mana.
But fizz is braindead AND the litteral definition of cancer.
ur mom.
no u
